title: Alternator Cover - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Warning - Alternator rotor magnets finger injury SM

The rotor magnets are very strong. When handling the alternator cover the magnets may 'grab' the stator, causing injury to the hands or fingers. When handling the alternator cover wear suitable gloves and only grip the alternator cover by the outside surfaces; always keep hands and fingers clear when handling the alternator cover.
Alternator cover removal PM1; PR1; PRB; PRC; PS1; PSB; PSC; PWC; PX1; PXB; PXC; PY1; PYB; PYC
If fitted, remove the left hand engine protection bar. See
The alternator and crankshaft position sensor share the same harness.
Note the routing of the alternator harness for installation.
Detach the alternator harness from the wire guide.
Disconnect the crankshaft position sensor from the main harness.

body.name: Alternator harness PM1 PR1 PS1 B02087

body.body: Route the alternator and crankshaft position sensor harnesses down to the alternator cover.
Place an oil catch tray beneath the alternator cover to collect any oil that may spill out on removal.
Release the fixings securing the alternator cover in the sequence shown below.
Carefully withdraw the cover. Discard the gasket.
Note the position of the two locating dowels for installation.
Clean the surfaces of the crankcase and the alternator cover using a lint free cloth.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: PWC; PRC; PRB; PR1; PM1; PYB; PXB; PSB; PYC; PXC; PSC; PX1; PY1; PS1

A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

The rotor magnets are very strong. When handling the alternator cover the magnets may 'grab' the stator, causing injury to the hands or fingers. When handling the alternator cover wear suitable gloves and only grip the alternator cover by the outside surfaces; always keep hands and fingers clear when handling the alternator cover.

Alternator harness
Wire guide
Crankshaft position sensor harness
Route the alternator and crankshaft position sensor harnesses down to the alternator cover.
Place an oil catch tray beneath the alternator cover to collect any oil that may spill out on removal.
Release the fixings securing the alternator cover in the sequence shown below.
Alternator Cover Release Sequence
Carefully withdraw the cover. Discard the gasket.
Note the position of the two locating dowels for installation.
Clean the surfaces of the crankcase and the alternator cover using a lint free cloth.
